title: 820-01700-A 20v 30mA
message:
20v 30mA on all USBC

Dead machine, corrosion on C9583, C9584, both replaced but pp2v5_nand_ssd0 still 0v
U9580 reflowed then lifted and refitted - no change.
Board otherwise immaculate.

ppbus_g3h 12.6v
pp3v3_g3h 3.3v
pp5v_g3h 5.1v
pp1v8_slps2r 1.8v
pp1v8_slp2rsw_dfr 0v
pp1v8_awake 1.8v
pp3v3_s5 0v (not shorted)

Not seen by Apple Configurator 2 run on non T2 MacBook at possibly different MacOS.

title: 820-01700-A 20v 30mA
message:
"pp2v5_nand_ssd0 still 0v"
What about diode mode to ground there?

title: 820-01700-A 20v 30mA
message:
Check if all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are present.
Be sure to follow all the steps to put the machine in DFU mode.
Also try using SWK003 pads...

title: 820-01700-A 20v 30mA
message:
pp1v2_awake 1.2v
pp1v8_awake 1.8v
pp3v3_awake 3.3v
ppvddcpu_awake 0.75v
pp0v8_slps2r 0.8v
pp1v1_slps2r 1.1v
pp1v8_slps2r 1.8v

Tried to get DFU mode via instructions on [URL]https://logi.wiki/index.php/DFU_Mode_Restore_(Macs)[/URL] AND via momentary short of SWK003 to no effect on A1502/BigSur/AC2.
Then tried soldering perm jumper over SWK003 and success getting DFU mode

title: 820-01700-A 20v 30mA
message: You must release the jumper, once entered into DFU.

title: 820-01700-A 20v 30mA
message: I wondered. Is the idea to restore? Does this wipe customers files - as the screen message alludes to?

title: 820-01700-A 20v 30mA
message:
Restore erase the SSD.
Do Revive instead...

title: 820-01700-A 20v 30mA
message:
Revive appears to timeout with "System cannot be restored on this device - Gave up waiting for device to transition from DFU state to DFU state".

Even "Restart Device" which I consider a safe option fails with message "Configurator could not perform the requested action - Apple Controller devices do not support this action".
BTW I have never seen a successful completion by Apple Configurator previously on other boards either - have you see completion messages?

title: 820-01700-A 20v 30mA
message:
When complete, there is no message at all.
Usually get the padlock logo on AC2 machine.

title: 820-01700-A 20v 30mA
message:
Can you suggest a next step?
Ive got a new U9580 (TPS62180 on order) as it is not outputting yet it has input powered 12.6v and enable 1.8v

title: 820-01700-A 20v 30mA
message:
A new U9580 now gives me a constant 2.5v on PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 :)
and I see currents ranging up to around 0.3amps before it finally reduces to 0.00 amps so I suspect its getting further along.
When connected only to screen no change in behaviour.

When I get into DFU mode, cut jumper lead and try revive it gets to step 4 of 4 with blue progress bar at 100% and after a while says what Ive always seen "Gave up waiting for device to transition from DFU state state to DFU state"

Will this board fan spin if good or am I just looking for a much increased current draw to know its working?
Do I need anything connected to the board that booting requires e.g. fingerprint switch.

pp3v3_s5 and pp3v3_s0 still 0v

title: 820-01700-A 20v 30mA
message:
Try with both charger and battery connected.
BTW, 96/140W for this board.

Do you get all G3S and SSD voltages now?
I suspect damage on SSD chips, caused by corrosion in U9580 area.

title: 820-01700-A 20v 30mA
message: New U9580 and correct PSU and board now boots. Thanks for your help
